review_title: A lot of mentorship, promotion schedule lame.
pros: A lot of mentorship and learning. Diverse population.
cons: The promotion schedule is often unfair, making it seem that it’s easy to grow—but only allows for so many promotions a year. So much talk about productivity, but there’s so many problems beyond the therapist. Poor morale, a lot of complaining between therapists.

pros: big company with good benefits

pros: Work load is reasonable facility is clean, decent health benefits bonuses to come in extra are excellent for us nice place
cons: Therapy is getting over on insurance payouts they document an hour of therapy but only do 45 minutes sometimes less, Nurses are nice but overworked some CNAs are rude and let call bells ring and expect RNs to answer them they eat and drink on the floor and use computers to shop online or listen to music on YouTube take long lunch breaks or sneak off the floor to move their cars without notifying the Charge Nurse

pros:
Friendly co-workers.
Good opportunities for education.
Good mentoring by other staff/clinicians.
Looks good on a resume.
Opportunity to move within the company among sites is supported by management.
cons:
Pay for PTAs is POOR, barely a living wage.
PTAs must work with 7-10 PTs each, know all of their treatment styles, approaches, documentation styles, preferences...etc. 
No possibility for promotion or merit based raises resulting in little support for clinical education time for PTAs, though PTs get many of these opportunities.
Benefits are mediocre.
Too many mangers/superiors.
Management is not trustworthy.
Too few employees in this position throughout the system gives us no voice.

review_title: Not quite the same as working for UPHS
pros:
Working at a well respected hospital
Excellent, dedicated coworkers 
Compassionate, honest Site Manager
Great location
Good salary
Online library with staff to help, as needed
cons:
Different than actually working for the hospital, feel like you dont really belong anywhere when you work for GSPP at a UPHS hospital
Benefits are becoming more expensive every year
Productivity focused

review_title: LTACH is over worked and has staffing/management issues.  New nurses, enter LTACH knowing it can be demoralizing.
pros: Pay seems higher than average.  Staff are awesome (90%). Lots of experience with higher acuity population.
cons: Management treats staff as disposable.  Staffing ratios can be unreasonable and cancellations will happen regardless of patient acuity.

review_title: Great professional development for a self-motivated clinician, but without a collaborative feel
pros: Excellent place to learn and develop subspecialty skills when early in one's career.
cons: More bureaucracy than most PT clinics. Culture varies significantly from clinic to clinic. Not the most collaborative place to work.

review_title: I enjoyed working for this company very much, I gained a great deal of experience.

cons: At time you might feel over whelmed if you don't comprehend your job at hand.
